content.question: Which of the following best represents the distribution of charge on the surfaces of spheres <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is brought near sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure presents a diagram with two spheres, labeled Sphere A on the right side and Sphere B on the left side of the figure. Sphere A has 6 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere. Sphere B has 4 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere and 4 negative charges spread across the left side of the sphere.

The figure presents a diagram with two spheres, labeled Sphere A on the right side and Sphere B on the left side of the figure. Sphere A has 6 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere. Sphere B has 4 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere and 7 negative charges spread across the left side of the sphere.

The figure presents a diagram with two spheres, labeled Sphere A on the right side and Sphere B on the left side of the figure. Sphere A has 6 positive charges spread across the left side of the sphere. Sphere B has 4 positive charges spread across the left side of the sphere and 4 negative charges spread across the right side of the sphere.

The figure presents a diagram with two spheres, labeled Sphere A on the right side and Sphere B on the left side of the figure. Sphere A has 6 positive charges spread across the left side of the sphere. Sphere B has 4 negative charges spread across the left side of the sphere and 4 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere.

content.answer: The figure presents a diagram with two spheres, labeled Sphere A on the right side and Sphere B on the left side of the figure. Sphere A has 6 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere. Sphere B has 4 positive charges spread across the right side of the sphere and 4 negative charges spread across the left side of the sphere.
